structured.description: Two functions: `Representational` and `calculate`. The `Representational` function takes three color channels (red, green, and blue) as input and returns a value based on their intensity. The `calculate` function takes an image as input and applies the `Representational` function to each pixel to obtain a new set of values. The main function reads two images, calculates the difference between them using the `calculate` function, and computes the peak signal-to-noise ratio (PSNR) for the difference using the formula `10 * log10(error / (255 * 255))`.

items.description: Takes an image as input and splits its RGB channels into separate components (red, green, blue). It then returns a representation of the image's pixel values as a Representational object.

params.name: img
params.description: Passed to the split() method to separate its RGB channels into individual integers, which are then used to create a Representational object.

returns.description: A combination of red, green and blue pixel values from an input image.

items.name: calculate

items.description: Performs image comparison by calculating the difference between two images, computing the PSNR (Peak Signal-to-Noise Ratio) and printing the result.
items.name: main
